result.execSummary:
The defendant Lenzie Raynic Jaster Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 3; credit of 25 days time served; Huber privileges for work and child care
Court gives defendant 48 hours to Report to Probation Intake and DNA swab

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $275.00 to MSS.
Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA and restitution during term of probation. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- Mental Health Assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Anger Management Course or Batterers Intervention Program.
- Cognitive Behavioral therapy Coure.

- No further violations of the law.
- NO CONTACT with TFC, MSS.
- No use or possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons.
- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1; credit of 25 days time served; Huber privileges for work and child care

timeConds.notes: Serve 20 days in HOC; release for work and child care. Court stays Report Date to 11-01-2022 by 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lenzie Raynic Jaster Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lenzie Raynic Jaster Jr in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Lenzie Raynic Jaster Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state. On state's motion, Court orders Count 1 Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer dismissed.

As to amended Count 1 and Count 3: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by MSS, TFC.

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 3, credit of 25 days time served, Huber privileges for work and child care. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

As to Count 3: Defendant ordered to serve 210 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, credit of 25 days time served, Huber privileges for work and child care. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

Conditions of Probation
- As to Count 3: Serve 20 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, release for work and child care. Court stays report date to 11-01-2022 by 5pm.
- No further violations of the law.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- 40 hours of community service.
- No contact with TFC, MSS. 
- No use or possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons. 
- Anger management course or batterers intervention program. 
- Cognitive behavioral therapy course.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $275.00 to MSS. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, and restitution during term of probation. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court gives defendant 48 hours to report for probation intake and DNA swab.

Appeal rights given.

Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report, filed.

Defendant Lenzie Raynic Jaster in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Lenzie Raynic Jaster in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lenzie Raynic Jaster appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. As to count 1, Court orally amends "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer from (939.63(1)(b)) to (939.63(1)(a)). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
